defs._def: people
extras: Tinha uma gente esperando na porta.There were some people waiting at the door.
A gloriosa história da gente portuguesa.The glorious history of the Portuguese people.
Gente, preciso de ajuda.Guys, I need help.

defs._def: a group of two or more persons
extras: Tinha uma gente esperando na porta.There were some people waiting at the door.

defs._def: persons forming a distinct identity
extras: A gloriosa história da gente portuguesa.The glorious history of the Portuguese people.

defs._def: guys, folks (informal address to a group of people)
extras: Gente, preciso de ajuda.Guys, I need help.

defs._def: (historical, Ancient Rome) gens (in Ancient Rome, a group of people descending from a common ancestor)

(colloquial) Used in informal speech, with the feminine singular definite article (a), as a substitute for the first-person plural pronoun (nós). The verb is then conjugated in the singular third-person (ele, ela). See: a gente
extras: We jumped in the pool.A gente pulou na piscina. / Nós pulamos na piscina
We study everyday.A gente estuda todos os dias. / Nós estudamos todos os dias.

defs._def: people
(transitive) This term needs a translation to English. Please help out and add a translation, then remove the text {{rfdef}}.
(transitive) to uproot, root out, eradicate

alt: a cavalo dado não se olham os dentes
_word: a cavalo dado não se olha os dentes

defs._def: don't look a gift horse in the mouth (do not unappreciatively question a gift)
(anatomy) anus
knife
Lua error: not enough memory. See Wiktionary:Lua memory errors for more information.
genius
(Roman mythology) the tutelary deity or spirit of a place or person
a trait of personal character; characteristic; nature, quality
someone possessing extraordinary intelligence or skill; especially somebody who has demonstrated this by a creative or original work in science, music, art etc.
genie, Jinn (a spirit, either good or evil, of pre-Islamic and Islamic mythology)
irritability (the tendency of getting angry, annoyed)
plural of grilhão
(figuratively) fetter (anything that restricts or restrains in any way) prison, captivity, bondage
to kill (to cause to die)
extras: Mataram-no a tiros!They shot him dead!(literally, “[They] killed him with gunshots!”)
A geada matará a plantação.The frost will kill the crop.
Ela matou-se com a faca.She killed herself with the knife.

defs._def: (figuratively, transitive) to kill; to eradicate; to destroy
extras: Matou-lhe as esperançasHe killed his hopes.

defs._def: (figuratively, informal, transitive) to kill (to cause extreme pain, distress or exhaustion in)
extras: Minhas pernas estão me matandoMy legs are killing me!
Essas palavras matam!These words kill!

defs._def: (transitive) to kill (to write a story that conveys the death of)
extras: Hobbes matara o positivismo acerca da revolução.Hobbes had killed the positivism surrounding the revolution.

defs._def: (figuratively, transitive) to satisfy, to satiate, to quench (to fulfil an emotional or physiological need)
extras: Antes de matar meu desejo de caminhar, preciso matar minha sede.Before I satisfy my desire to walk, I need to quench my thirst.

defs._def: (figuratively, takes a reflexive pronoun) to break one's back (to make a great effort)
extras: O homem se matava para sustentar a família.The man broke his back providing for his family.

defs._def: (colloquial, transitive) to spend [a period of time] doing unimportant things
extras: A escola ficou fechada hoje; tive o dia inteiro para matar.School was closed today; I had the entire day to goof around.

defs._def: (Brazil, slang, transitive) to skip (not to be present in a class)
extras: Os alunos mataram a aula de geografia.The students skipped geography class.

defs._def: (informal, transitive) to solve (to find the solution to a mystery)
extras: Finalmente matei a charada.I have finally solved the riddle.

defs._def: (Brazil, slang, transitive) to consume something entirely (especially an alcoholic drink); to knock down
extras: Matamos uns cascos para relaxar.We knocked down a few forties to relax.

defs._def: (sports, transitive) to stop a moving ball
extras: Passei de longe para o atacante, que matou a bola no peito.I passed the ball to the striker from a distance; he then stopped it with his chest.

defs._def: (cue sports, transitive) to pocket (to cause a ball to go into one of the pockets of the table)
extras: Ela sempre mata duas ou três bolas na primeira tacada.She always pockets two or three balls with the first strike.
